intro: Guatteria choroniensis, commonly known as the Choroniensis Guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within humid forests. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for tropical biodiversity and its potential ecological value in forest ecosystems.
